history.content: It has not been released yet. Once ready it will likely be posted on old 61B piazzas. If you want to become a reader/tutor you do not necessarily have to first AI for a class; however, it certainly helps you to learn the material better and begin to learn to teach the material. If you are serious about becoming a reader/tutor, AIing or otherwise getting involved with teaching is a great first step!

children.subject: Formerly referred to as lab assistants, academic interns help out in labs and office hours. At minimum you must pass the course and have an interest in the material, though some classes may have additional requirements. All AIs are volunteers and can request to get P/NP units depending on how many hours they work per week.
How many hours does an academic intern usually work? Is there a minimum (or a max)? What's the workload like? Do you simply have to show up to office hours and labs or is there other work involved?

It depends on the class. For 61A during the semester, AIs could get 1 P/NP unit for every 3 hours per week of work, which is broken down into 1.5 hours for lab, 1 hour of office hours, and 30min per week of prep work (reviewing the necessary labs/homeworks/projects/content of the week). No minimum hours per week if you're not doing it for units. This is all for 61A though, I imagine it's slightly different for 61B and other courses.
Do you guys think being an AI looks good on a resume (not tryna be one of “those people” but I’m just curious)?
If you put it as AI on your resume, company bots might mistake it for the artificial intelligence "buzzword" and you might get a ton of interview requests lolol
What exactly does a 61B academic intern do? Is that the same as a lab assistant, and what are the qualifications to be one?
When are they expected to be released? If you haven't been an academic intern for the past school year, will the link for academic intern sign ups be posted on Spring 2017 61B pages?

Just wondering when 61B academic intern sign ups will be available. CS61A academic intern sign ups are already available and the semester is just about to begin. Is there any expected date the sign ups for CS61B academic intern will be available?

history.content:
When is the application period for this? And where should we look if it isn't open yet? I'm just having a hard time finding information about this. Thank you!
Also in order to become a reader/tutor, do you have to have previously been an Academic Intern for the class?
